title: Visualisation Functions for Health-GPS
text: goal healthgpsrvis plot visualise data related Health-GPS.

title: Visualisation Functions for Health-GPS
text: RStudio installed

title: Visualisation Functions for Health-GPS
text: can install development version healthgpsrvis GitHub :

title: Visualisation Functions for Health-GPS
text: basic example shows solve common problem:  special using README.Rmd instead just README.md? can include R chunks like : ’ll still need render README.Rmd regularly, keep README.md --date. devtools::build_readme() handy . can also embed plots, example: case, don’t forget commit push resulting figure files, display GitHub CRAN.
code: library(healthgpsrvis) data_mean_weighted <- data.frame(     time = rep(seq(2020, 2055, by = 5), 3),     weighted_bmi = runif(24, 25, 38),     weighted_energyintake = runif(24, 1700, 2750),     weighted_fat = runif(24, 38, 120),     weighted_obesity = runif(24, 0.1, 0.7),     weighted_protein = runif(24, 46, 210),     weighted_sodium = runif(24, 874, 2768),     source = rep(c("Source_1", "Source_2", "Source_3"), each = 8)   ) plot_bmi <- riskfactors("bmi", data_mean_weighted) plot_bmi #> Warning: Use of `data_mean_weighted$time` is discouraged. #> ℹ Use `time` instead. # summary(cars)

title: Data Processing — DataProcessing
text: file contains set functions designed work together processing data. description use functions sequence.

title: Data Processing — DataProcessing
text: Read data: function reads data location specified.   gen_data_mean: Calculates weighted mean values various metrics years.   gen_data_weighted_rf: Calculates differences intervention baseline values risk factors.   gen_data_weighted_ds: Calculates differences intervention baseline values incidences.   gen_data_weighted_burden: Calculates differences intervention baseline values burden disease.   gen_data_weighted_burden_spline: Performs data smoothing burden disease, necessary. instance, simulations, can positive values difference burden disease.   gen_data_le: Calculates life expectancy various age groups.
code: data <-  readRDS("data.rds") data_weighted <- gen_data_mean(data) data_weighted_rf_wide_collapse <- gen_data_weighted_rf(data_weighted) data_weighted_ds_wide_collapse <- gen_data_weighted_ds(data_weighted) data_weighted_burden_wide_collapse <- gen_data_weighted_burden(data_weighted) data_weighted_burden_spline <- gen_data_weighted_burden_spline(data_weighted_burden_wide_collapse) data_ple_wide <- gen_data_le(data_weighted)

title: Data Processing — DataProcessing
code: # Example of using all functions together data <- readRDS("data.rds") data_weighted <- gen_data_mean(data) data_weighted_rf_wide_collapse <- gen_data_weighted_rf(data_weighted) data_weighted_ds_wide_collapse <- gen_data_weighted_ds(data_weighted) data_weighted_burden_wide_collapse <- gen_data_weighted_burden(data_weighted) data_weighted_burden_spline <- gen_data_weighted_burden_spline(data_weighted_burden_wide_collapse) data_ple_wide <- gen_data_le(data_weighted)

title: Combined Plot of several metrics — combine_plots

title: Customised theme for ggplot2 — hgps_theme
text: function creates customised theme ggplot2 plots. modifies various elements default theme_classic() provide specific style.

title: Customised theme for ggplot2 — hgps_theme
Customised theme for ggplot2 — hgps_theme
text: ggplot2 theme object customised settings plot title, axis titles, axis text, legend text, legend title, major grid lines, legend key background, legend position.

title: Customised theme for ggplot2 — hgps_theme
text: hgps_theme function modifies following elements classic theme: plot.title: Sets font size plot title (default 15). axis.title.x: Sets font size x-axis title (default 10). axis.title.y: Sets font size y-axis title (default 10). axis.text.x: Sets font size x-axis text (default 8). axis.text.y: Sets font size y-axis text (default 8). legend.text: Sets font size legend text (default 8). legend.title: Removes legend title. panel.grid.major.x: Adds major grid lines x-axis. legend.key: Sets legend key background (default "transparent"). legend.position: Positions legend (default coordinates (0.8, 0.9)).

title: Customised theme for ggplot2 — hgps_theme
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(ggplot2) ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = wt, y = mpg)) +     geom_point() +     hgps_theme() } # }

what: Set up a new plotting device — set_graphics
title: Set up a new plotting device — set_graphics
text: function closes existing graphical devices opens new one specified width height dimensions.

title: Set up a new plotting device — set_graphics
Set up a new plotting device — set_graphics
text: width Numeric value specifying width new plotting device centimeters. height Numeric value specifying height new plotting device centimeters.

title: Set up a new plotting device — set_graphics
text: set_graphics function first closes open graphical devices using graphics.(). opens new graphical device given dimensions using dev.new(). unit parameter set "cm" use centimeters dimensions, noRStudioGD set TRUE avoid using RStudio's graphical device.

title: Set up a new plotting device — set_graphics
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Set up a new plotting device with width 10 cm and height 7 cm set_graphics(10, 7) } # }
